Sentencas: Samarium-doped ceria (SDC) is coated onto a Ni/yttria-stabilized zirconia (Ni/YSZ) anode for the direct use of methane in solid-oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions

Sentencas: Porous SDC thin layer is applied to the anode using the sol-gel coating method.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions

Sentencas: The experiment was performed in H-2 and CH4 conditions at 800 A degrees C.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions

Sentencas: The cell performance was improved by approximately 20 % in H-2 conditions by the SDC coating, due to the high ionic conductivity, the mixed ionic and electronic conductive property of the SDC, and the increased triple phase boundary area by the SDC coating in the anode.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions

Sentencas: Carbon was hardly deposited in the SDC-coated Ni/YSZ anode.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions

Sentencas: The cell performance of the SDC-coated Ni/YSZ anode did not show any significant degradation for up to 90 h under 0.1 A cm(-2) at 800 A degrees C.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions

Sentencas: The porous thin SDC coating on the Ni/YSZ anode provided the electrochemical oxidation of CH4 over the whole anode, and minimized the carbon deposition by electrochemical carbon oxidation.
Titulo: Carbon-tolerance effects of Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-δ modified Ni/YSZ anode for solid oxide fuel cells under methane fuel conditions
